results.title: Lest we forget
results.brief_description: A message from mother to son, Darcy who was born on Anzac day 1996. She wants to explain to him that his father left, but that is not his fault and that she is always there for him.

results.title: Journey
results.brief_description: Inspired by Gary’s neighbour Tony, who emigrated from Italy in 1952. Describes what people had to go through in search of a better life in Australia.

results.title: of day, of night
results.brief_description: This experimental interactive CD-ROM explores the intersections of narrative, subjectivity and interactivity. A hybrid of cinematic, textual and interactive elements, it finds resonances between dream experience and the unexpected associations inherent in new media forms. A map of sorts. A handful of objects. A problem with dreaming. Found objects and their imagined traces and histories assist a woman who has a problem with dreaming.

results.title: I am a singer
results.creator_credit: Megan Heyward and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: This award winning interactive CD-Rom weaves a fragmentary narrative about an amnesiac famed for her singing. Exploring notions of performance, autobiography and memory this is an intriguing and compelling story in which the viewer helps to reconstruct the events of a life lived through song.

results.title: Persuaders
results.creator_credit: David Chesworth, Sonia Leber and Wax Sound Media
results.brief_description:
The installation is composed from ‘fragments’ of video and audio captured in real time from short bursts of activity to longer passages of action or inaction.

Each monitor contains an individual person who has been videotaped while barracking for a particular sport. Each person is presented in close-up, with the eyeline straight to camera, staring directly at the viewer. The sound of each person is also in ‘close-up’, transmitted through a number of loudspeakers in the space. With apparent proximity, we can hear great detail in the breath and voice.

results.title: Grierson Lecture 1999: Screen literacy and cultural morality in the digital era
results.brief_description:
A record of the 1999 Grierson Lecture by Lord David Putnam entitled, `Screen Literacy and Cultural Morality in the Digital Era’.

Includes:

Introduction by Jenifer Hooks Executive Director Cinemedia;
Introduction by The Honourable Mary Delahunty MP Minister for the Arts;
The Grierson Lecture
Closing remarks by Jenifer Hooks Executive Director Cinemedia;

results.title: Passionless moments
results.brief_description: A series of suburban vignettes dealing with everyday eccentricities. Filmed in black and white, this is an early work by renowned New Zealand filmmaker Jane Campion. Through a series of alternately ironic and bizarre vignettes, the filmmaker composes a joyful celebration to the beauty of the mundane and the ordinary.

results.title: Kitchen sink
results.brief_description: A woman finds an unidentified root growing out of her kitchen sink plug hole. The umbilical like vine grows into an adult male covered in hair from head to toe. The woman shaves the catatonic man and the two begin to play out a primal scene of lust and longing. Alison Maclean’s perverse horror recasts desire in its most primordial and visceral guise.
